definitions.definition: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you:
examples: She scrambled up the steep hillside and over the rocks.

definitions.definition: to compete with other people for something there is very little of:
examples: [ + to infinitive ] People are scrambling to buy property before prices rise even further.

definitions.definition: a climb that is difficult so that you have to use your hands to help you:
examples: It was a real scramble to the top of the hillside.
